definition: to have a fist fight/fist fight/brawl
abbr. for the Big Dipper constellation 北斗星[Bei3 dou3 xing1]
to fight/to struggle/to condemn/to censure/to contend/to put together/coming together
dry measure for grain equal to ten 升[sheng1] or one-tenth of a 石[dan4]/decaliter/peck/cup or dipper shaped object/old variant of 陡[dou3]

sentences.chinese: 在一家酒吧的殴斗中被刺杀。

sentences.english: The demonstration got out of control and fighting broke out.
sentences.chinese: 示威失去控制，继而发生殴斗。

sentences.english: Their scuffle was stopped by the riot police.
sentences.chinese: 他们的殴斗被防暴警察制止了。

sentences.english: The policemen came and restrained the two men from fighting.
sentences.chinese: 警察来到并制止了这两个人的殴斗。

sentences.english: And just when my body heals , you make me do it again.
sentences.chinese: 我的身体刚刚痊愈，你就叫我再去殴斗。

sentences.english: Your mother has ever been involved in a fistfight at a high school sports event.
sentences.chinese: 你的母亲从未参与了殴斗在高中体育盛会。

sentences.english: The police broke up the fight.
They stopped me going out of the door.
sentences.chinese: 警察被召去制止剧场外的一场殴斗。

sentences.english: They were convicted of affray and received community service sentences.
sentences.chinese: 他们因殴斗滋事被判决为社区义务服务。

sentences.english: The killings were not only because of Saturday brawls.
sentences.chinese: 流血和杀戮随时发生，并不限于星期六的殴斗。

sentences.english: We hung out on the boardwalk in front of the hotel like we were bad-asses looking for a fistfight .
sentences.chinese: 我们挂出的波德沃克在酒店前像我们坏评寻找殴斗。

sentences.english: We were all hurled into the battle before the police dispersed us.
sentences.chinese: 在警察驱散我们之前，我们全都参加了那场殴斗。

sentences.english: A sudden outburst of fighting among rival soccer fans developedsintosa riot.
sentences.chinese: 一场突发的对立球迷间的殴斗演变成了一场暴动。

definition: to fight together/to come to blows
to cause trouble/to provoke a dispute
to beat up/to come to blows/battery (law)
to pick a quarrel/to start a fight
violent crime/to commit a violent act (assault or murder)
to square off/to exchange blows/to rain blows on sb
